bioghist.p: Henry Howard Houston (1820-1895) was a leading Philadelphia businessman, philanthropist, and a major developer in the Chestnut Hill and Germantown sections of the city. His son, Samuel Frederic Houston (1866-1952), was a banker and a trustee at the University of Pennsylvania; Samuel's son Henry Howard Houston II (1895-1918) died in World War I. Lawrence M. C. Smith (1902-1975) was a U.S. government official and Philadelphia civic leader. He and his wife Eleanor Houston Smith (1910-1987) were conservationists and helped to establish the Schuylkill Valley Nature Center. The materials in this collection were collected by Francis J. Dallett.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of clippings, articles, invitations, photographs, and other materials related to Henry H. Houston, Samuel Frederic Houston, Henry Howard Houston II, Lawrence M. C. Smith and Eleanor Houston Smith, and the Woodward, Henry, Dallet, and Brown families. The collection also includes blueprints, photographs, and clippings related to Henry Howard Houston's estate Druim Moir and Brinkwood, Samuel F. Houston's estate, built in 1887.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
